title: Custom 404 Error Page
description:
Design and Implement Custom 404 Error Page

Create a user-friendly custom 404 error page that helps visitors navigate back to relevant content when they encounter broken or non-existent URLs.

Requirements:
- Design a visually appealing layout that maintains consistent site branding (logo, colors, typography, header/footer)
- Include clear, friendly messaging explaining the page was not found without technical jargon
- Provide prominent navigation links to key pages (homepage, main sections, sitemap)
- Add a working search bar to help users find what they're looking for
- Implement SEO-friendly elements (proper 404 HTTP status code, meta tags, heading structure)
- Include helpful suggestions or popular pages to reduce user frustration
- Ensure responsive design works across mobile, tablet, and desktop devices
- Add tracking/analytics to monitor which URLs are triggering 404 errors
- Consider adding contextual help based on the attempted URL pattern if applicable
- Test that the 404 page is properly triggered for non-existent routes without affecting valid pages

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Handle URLs with special characters or encoding issues
- Ensure 404 returns correct status code for SEO (not 200 or soft 404)
- Verify behavior for authenticated vs non-authenticated users
- Test with various URL patterns (missing pages, typos, old URLs)
